docs.snippet: Mike Francesa and Christopher Russo, known for their longtime WFAN sports-talk radio show, will appear March 30 in a live-broadcast event....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mike Francesa and Christopher Russo, known for their longtime WFAN sports-talk radio show, will appear March 30 in a live-broadcast event.
docs.abstract: Sportscasters Mike Francesa and Christopher Russo will reunite for Mike and the Mad Dog Reunion Show, one-night performance to be broadcast live from Radio City Music Hall as benefit for children’s charity Garden of Dreams Foundation; tickets for show sold-out within 24 hours of release, demonstrating enduring popularity of former WFAN radio sports-talk duo.

headline.main: Mike and the Mad Dog Rev Up for a Radio City Reunion
headline.print_headline: Brash Radio Duo Rev Up for Reunion

docs.snippet: Ibtihaj Muhammad of Maplewood, N.J., who will compete at the Rio Games, played a lot of sports growing up, but only one had a uniform that allowed her to be totally covered....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ibtihaj Muhammad of Maplewood, N.J., who will compete at the Rio Games, played a lot of sports growing up, but only one had a uniform that allowed her to be totally covered.
docs.abstract: Fencer Ibtihaj Muhammad is believed to be first American to compete in Olympics wearing hijab; came to sport because uniform required no alterations to comply with traditional Muslim attire; Duke graduate switched from epee to saber after high school and is key member of United States team expected to vie for gold medal in Rio.

headline.main: Olympic Fencer, a Muslim, Settled on a ‘Sport Without Alteration’
headline.print_headline: Opening a Door for Muslim Women

docs.snippet: The S&P 500 ended flat on Wednesday, losing gains late in the session as investors digested comments by Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen, who kept options open for more rate hikes but also saw risks to the U.S. economy....
